snippet: There is a quiet realization that American factories need subsidies to survive globally — especially to compete with Asian and European companies that routinely receive government assistance.
abstract: American management and labor agree that manufacturing needs help in the form of federal, state and local subsidies, along with labor concessions, for survival in a global economy in which Asian and European companies are routinely subsidized; such support is leading to a rebirth in manufacturing, reflected by a rise in its contribution to the gross domestic product.
lead_paragraph: There is a quiet realization that American factories need subsidies to survive globally — especially to compete with Asian and European companies that routinely receive government assistance.

headline.seo: Subsidies Aid Rebirth in U.S. Manufacturing
